name: Palm Garden Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Palm Garden resort is a nice place to unwind especially after the hustle bustle of the main cities. We were glad we chose a resort to stay in in Hoi An rather than a hotel in the town area. The only downside of that is that to get to the town (3km away) you have to take a shuttle. The resort had a few shuttles a day to and from the town area which made it very convenient, however the times were not always ideal. So have to catch a cab or motorbike back.

reviews.text: While the grounds of this hotel are extremely beautiful including an open air lobby, beautiful spa area, pool and beach there are some things that could have been better. The bathrooms are a bit outdated and could be improved but generally good. The walls were thin and you could hear your neighbors which was a bit annoying. And while the spa looks beautiful from the outside its a bit of a weird experience. We went for facials and the ladies clearly didn't know what they were doing and they rubbed our face for about an hour. The massage was okay but nothing special, especially for the price. It was also creepy that they have a person walk inside the ladies change room and she has to sit there while you change and get ready....it was a bit discomforting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Palm Gardens was an oasis of calm in busy Vietnam. The perfect place to come back to at the end of the day and unwind. Plenty going on to keep you entertained with themed dinner nights etc. Pool was fantastic and many hours were spent stretched out by the pool sipping cocktails. Rooms were spacious and well appointed - loved the wetroom style bathroom. Lovely touches such as water at each door to wash off your feet from the beach, flowers on the bed and updates daily on weather, activities etc. Front desk were fantastic and provided lots of options for tours. The one tour we took up to My Son was perfect - a small group, left to own devices at the ruins, cold water and towels provided pre and post walking around the ruins. Also enjoyed a private cooking lesson with a chef from the resort which was a highlight. Would absolutely return to Palm Gardens again and recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: relaxing retreat from reality

likes.disliked: — Beach wasn't fantastic - not inviting at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 10 days at Palm Garden and was very pleased with our stay. Was told that 10 days would be too long but really there is so much to do and see in Hoi An that it was a perfect length of stay. We booked through Aurora Travel who got us a great deal on a Superior Ocean View room. If you can, do go for an Ocean View as some of the Garden View rooms in my opinion are very close together with limited privacy. Also ask for a upper story, we had a ground floor room and had to keep the curtains drawn as people looked in a lot! The bungalows looked great, but again ask for ones by the beach, some near the pool would have been very public. The room itself was perfect, factastic decor, very very clean. Great marble bathroom with walk in shower. Housekeeping are really on the ball and keep the place immaculate. The grounds are very well kept, the gardeners are working all day to keep it that way. Very relaxing to just walk around the paths in the resort. Beach is huge and the staff always on hand to help with loungers/towels. Pool fab, very kid friendly. Really cant fault how this resort looks at all - night time is especially magical as there are fairy lights and candles all over the resort. Food wise, the seafood bbq was great and food in the main restuarant very much up to standard, but expensive. If you are a wine lover, forget it! Wine was $30 a bottle for the exact same wine i can get at home for $10. Only negative things i would say is that the staff are perhaps too keen - sometimes you just want to be left alone to chill out and they were always hovering nearby which got me a bit narked! Service even in the beach bar is very very formal, which again doesnt really help with the relaxing! Also most of the staff have very poor english, to the extent of not understanding our orders! I had to take the pad and write down 'sandwich with chicken' for one guy! In contrast to people in Hoi An town who all had excellent english. However i would totally recommend this resort, great combination of beach resort with a wonderfully historic town 5 min away. As for Hoi An, do yourself a favour and go to the Mango Rooms for dinner. We went 3 nights! Meal for 2 including wine was $80, and was on par with meal we had in London just before leaving that set us back $300. Fantastic place.
reviews.title: Great resort, fantastic town

likes.liked: — Location - Relax at the Pool then off into the Town, perfect combination

The breakfast was delicious and we were very happy with the cafes and restaurants within the resort. The pool is beautiful as is the beach. All the staff are friendly and the resort gardens are maintained very well.

reviews.text: quiet with extensive grounds and amazing vegetation. The pool was very large and the beach was beautiful with palm trees and looking either way it seemed to strech for miles. The rooms are very comfortable with a contemporary feel, but there is not enough cupboard space for two people. They should put some shelves up. The breakfast were wonderful and the staff couldn't have been any nicer. There is a shsuttle going into town 4 times a day. Perhaps they should offer more but it's only 1000 dong in a taxi to Hoi an. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was completelly full when we were there but you never felt crowded. We stayed from 20-30 April.

This was our relaxing and time out place, and it lived up to all our expectations. The outside main restaurant serves the most fab food and obviously wine!
reviews.title: Wonderful and fun part of our trip to Vietnam

aka: Palm Garden Beach Hotel Hoi An
description: Set on five hectares of landscaped tropical garden with over 400 species of palm trees and plants right along a 220-meter stretch of the famous Cua Dai, Palm Garden Beach Resort and Spa offers a touch of Hoi An’s traditional architectural design combined with a taste of modern luxury and only 5 minutes by car from the UNESCO- recognized World Heritage Hoi An ancient town. The combination of nature and a unique architecture remarkable of the culture of Hoi An make a distinctive character for Palm Garden Beach Resort and Spa. Elegant accommodation comprises 212 wooden-designed rooms and beachfront bungalows. Spacious guest rooms have been constructed from and furnished with natural materials, and all feature a private balcony and modern amenities. Resort facilities encompass a deluxe spa offering best products, a fitness centre complete with sauna, state of the art meeting facilities, water sports activities, a private beach, and a 969 square-metre outdoor pool surrounded by lush gardens. Guests are sure to enjoy the resort’s selection of cuisine, ranging from traditional Vietnamese to international specialties at restaurants.
